New Records: Jackson Chourio is the second-youngest player in postseason history with a multi-homer game.
Jackson Chourio is the second player in AL/NL history to hit two game-tying homers in the same postseason game.
Key Match Events: Garrett Mitchell hit a walk-off grand slam in the eighth inning
Chourio homered twice for the Brewers, tying the game both times
Mitchell hit a home run in the eighth inning after a two-out hit by Willy Adames
Francisco Lindor robbed Sal Frelick of a hit in the top of the second
Francisco Lindor made a nice play to shortstop, gathering the ball from his feet and firing a one-hop strike to first, retiring the hustling Contreras by less than a step
Willy Adames singled to right, bringing up Mitchell for his home-run heroics to complete the scoring
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Pat Murphy emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
Manager Carlos Mendoza said the team needs to put pressure on the bases and take the extra base when needed
Post-Match Reflections: Carlos Mendoza expressed pride in the team's resilience
Garrett Mitchell praised the team's ability to get back up after being knocked down
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers came back from two separate deficits to win the game
The Mets took a 1–0 lead in the top of the first and a 3–1 lead in the top of the second
The Brewers have won a postseason game in which they trailed entering the seventh inning for the first time since 1982
This is only the second Wild Card Series to go to a third game since 2022
